data.name: Fibonacci String Search
data.description:
A Fibonacci string `F(n)` for a natural number `n` is defined as:

``` 
F(1) = A
F(2) = B
F(n) = F(n-1) + F(n-2), n > 2
```

where `+` denotes string concatenation.

Some Examples `F(n)` values are:

```
F(3) = BA
F(4) = BAB
F(5) = BABBA
```

Find a solution that counts occurrences of a given string `S` consisting of characters `A` and `B` only, in the given Fibonacci string `F(n)`. The maximum length of `S` is 100,000, the maximum value of the given `n` is 1,000,000.

Hint: You may want to solve [The Millionth Fibonacci Kata](https://www.codewars.com/kata/53d40c1e2f13e331fc000c26) first.

Hint: There is a simple formula for summing a range of Fibonacci numbers.
